title: People
text:
John Bryant


John is a demographer and data scientist, specialising in Bayesian analysis, applied demography, and statistical computing. He has worked at Statistics New Zealand, the New Zealand Treasury, and the Institute for Population and Social Research in Thailand. He has a PhD in Demography from the Australian National University

Email: john@bayesiandemography.com





Junni Zhang


Junni is a statistician who likes tackling real problems. She is an Associate Professor at Peking University, China. She has skills in Bayesian statistics, machine learning, text mining, causal inference, and applied demography. She has a Ph.D. in Statistics from Harvard University.

Email: junni@bayesiandemography.com

title: Demography for the twenty-first century
text:
We develop and apply new demographic methods. We are the authors of the book Bayesian Demographic Estimation and Forecasting, and the developers of the R package bage.
Our methods work with

noisy data,
small populations, and
multiple data sources.

We help organizations with

building analysis pipelines, and
one-off analyses.

Current projects include

redesigning the UK population estimation system,
estimating historical Māori populations, and
measuring life expectancy for First Nations Australians.

Three statistical frameworks for modern demographic estimation and forecasting.


Book website
CRC Press

Bayesian Demographic Estimation and Forecasting uses R packages dembase, demest, demlife, demdata, and bdefdata. These packages are available on the Statistics New Zealand GitHub repository. We are, however, no longer updating these packages. For any new code, please use the packages listed in Software.
